abstract.p: Family Friendly Programming Forum names The Wonderful World of Disney and its predecessor programs as winner of its lifetime achievement award for 2000 (S)

block.p: The Family Friendly Programming Forum, an organization that seeks to encourage the development of television programming to be watched together by broader, multigenerational audiences, has named ''The Wonderful World of Disney'' and its predecessor programs as the winner of its lifetime achievement award for 2000.

The series, now broadcast by the ABC unit of the Walt Disney Company on Sunday evenings, was introduced as ''Disneyland'' in 1954 and has appeared under various names. The award is the second of its kind presented by the organization, which is supported by major marketers as well as large advertiser and agency trade organizations; the 1999 award was presented to ''The Cosby Show.''

Awards for ''family friendly'' television programs shown during 1999, in categories like comedy, drama and reality programming, will be presented on Aug. 3 in Los Angeles; CBS will broadcast the ceremony on Aug. 10.
